text: God commanded Jonah to go and preach against the wickedness of which city?
verseText: “Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and call out against it, for their evil has come up before me.”

text: Instead of going to Nineveh, where did Jonah attempt to flee?
verseText: But Jonah rose to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the LORD. He went down to Joppa and found a ship going to Tarshish.

text: What did God send while Jonah was on the ship to Tarshish?
verseText: But the LORD hurled a great wind upon the sea, and there was a mighty tempest on the sea, so that the ship threatened to break up.

text: How did the sailors discover Jonah was the cause of the storm?
verseText: And they said to one another, “Come, let us cast lots, that we may know on whose account this evil has come upon us.” So they cast lots, and the lot fell on Jonah.

text: What happened when the sailors threw Jonah overboard at his request?
verseText: So they picked up Jonah and hurled him into the sea, and the sea ceased from its raging.

text: What did God appoint to swallow Jonah?
verseText: And the LORD appointed a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

text: How long was Jonah inside the great fish?
verseText: And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

text: What was Jonah's message to the people of Nineveh?
options: 'Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown!'
verseText: Jonah began to go into the city, going a day's journey. And he called out, “Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown!”

text: How did the people of Nineveh, including the king, respond to Jonah's message?
options: They believed God, proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth (repented)
verseText: And the people of Nineveh believed God. They called for a fast and put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them to the least of them... When the king heard... he covered himself with sackcloth and sat in ashes.

text: Why was Jonah angry after God spared Nineveh?
options: He wanted them destroyed because they were Israel's enemies
His prophecy didn't come true immediately
verseText: But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was angry... “O LORD, is not this what I said when I was yet in my country? That is why I made haste to flee to Tarshish; for I knew that you are a gracious God and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, and relenting from disaster.
